CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 12, 1966, pg. 2A, reads: "As Dr. King Visited Pittsburgh - These were scenes as Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., leader of the American Civil Rights Movement, visited Pittsburgh for a speech, a press conference, and a student question-and-answer session at the University of Pittsburgh's Student Union last week... In far right photo, Dr. King is shown at question and answer period for students with Dr. Clifford Hamm, nationally known expert on housing and municipal affairs who heads Pitt's Division of Urban Affairs and who has been active locally to prod Pittsburghers on slums, housing and municipal issues. - Harris Photo."Cutline for image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 10, 1971, pg. 17, reads: "DR. KING IN PITTSBURGH - Scenes on an occasion when the great civil rights leader came to Pittsburgh to lend his support for the struggle for first class citizenship..."
TitMainTitle: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and Dr. Clifford Hamm, on small stage addressing crowd of men and women at question and answer session, University of Pittsburgh
CatSubject_tab: King, Martin Luther, Jr., 1929-1968.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Crowds--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.University of Pittsburgh.
